Class SimpleList<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimpleList<T>
  • public class SimpleList<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Simple Linked List, which means that each node has a link to the next node in the list.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SimpleList()
      Constructs and empty Simple Linkedlist

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns if the amount of elements in the list
        Returns:
        the actual amount of elements in the list. If the list is empty, returns 0.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns if the Simple List is empty or not.
        Returns:
        true if simple list does not have any element, and false if it does

      • addFirst

        public void addFirst​(T dato)
        Adds an element at the beginning of the list
        Parameters:
        dato - represents the value of the element that will be added

      • addLast

        public void addLast​(T dato)
        Adds an element at the end of the list
        Parameters:
        dato - represents the value of the element that will be added

      • add

        public void add​(T dato,
                int posn)
         throws SimpleListOutOfBoundsException
        Adds an element at the position indicaded.
        Parameters:
        dato - represents the value of the element that will be added
        posn - represents the position at which the element will be added. Positions starts in 0.
        Throws:
        SimpleListOutOfBoundsException

      • removeFirst

        public T removeFirst()
              throws EmptySimpleListException
        Removes the first element of the list and returns it.
        Returns:
        the element that was removed.
        Throws:
        EmptySimpleListException

      • removeLast

        public T removeLast()
             throws EmptySimpleListException
        Removes the last element of the list and returns it.
        Returns:
        the element that was removed.
        Throws:
        EmptySimpleListException

      • remove

        public T remove​(int posn)
         throws SimpleListOutOfBoundsException,
                EmptySimpleListException
        Removes an element on a specific position in the list.
        Parameters:
        posn - is the position of the element to be removed.
        Returns:
        the element that was removed.
        Throws:
        SimpleListOutOfBoundsException
        EmptySimpleListException

      • search

        public boolean search​(T d)
        Searches an object in the list
        Returns:
        if the element is contained in the list (true) or not (false).

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf​(T d)
        Searches an object in the list
        Returns:
        the position in the list where the element is found. It only returns the first position it is found, and return -1 if the element is not found in the list.

      • get

        public T get​(int posn)
      throws SimpleListOutOfBoundsException
        Gets the element in the list on a specific position
        Parameters:
        posn - the position of the element we want to get
        Returns:
        the element on the position
        Throws:
        SimpleListOutOfBoundsException

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        String format of the SimpleList
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String with all elements of the SimpleList
